pros: Is because I like their organization
- warehouse/truck teams are nice as can be. They always have each others best interests at heart
cons: - management is beyond clueless, and was very disconnected from warehouse or truck employees. Will turn on you in an instant.

review_title: You can't call it work when its this much fun!
pros: Progressive charity who embraces change, social enterprise, technology, values and dignity of the clients they serve and the donors who support them. Great managers - flat hierarchy, lots of open doors and a keen goal to get better every month. Use TinyPulse to get our feedback weekly - so very open to feedback good or bad.
cons: Kind of works like startup - always changing, so often times the way it WAS DONE... isn't neccessarily how it is NOW DONE. Not a bad thing, but can be a little confusing at times. Managers are all growing and trying to make the work and the mission of the charity very gratifying!

pros:
Changing lives since 2008! Every day is a great life changing adventure at Furniture Bank.

From collaborating with partners to grow our Social Enterprise, new marketing strategies, new charitable development for Chair Affair – every moment is focused on building the charity to help every Canadian who needs our support to get up off the floor.

Beyond the mission, we’ll enjoy a pint together, maybe catch a Jays game or just enjoy one another’s company. We are not just co-workers; we are a family that is connected by our cause and we know that 4 walls don’t make a home!
cons: I have nothing negative to say about Furniture Bank!

review_title: An Amazing Place to Work and Grow!
pros: Great environment, positive and encouraging culture, management that listens to your concerns, big future of growth and expansion, and you get to make your community a better place just by showing up to work!
cons: Traditional financial challenges that come along with being a non-profit organization, operating in the public eye means that you are always representing Furniture Bank, even outside of work.

pros: Social Enterprise meets Social Need. Business principles applied to a range of social and environmental challenges.
cons: Its a  charity, not always the funds on hand to move quickly. In that growth phase when many functions are just being rebuilt with growth and scaling in mind.

pros: Coworkers are amazing and wants Furniture Bank to succeed.

job_title: Manager, Strategic Partnerships in Toronto, ON
pros: Best people, visionary, daring, good works
cons: Becoming over dedicated is a risk
